newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent untraded, seen range trading.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent untraded, seen range trading.

text.p: September Brent crude futures ended Monday's session in Asia untraded but holding London's levels from late last week.
London and New York fell sharply on Friday as worries about disruption to U.S. Gulf output faded. Hurrican Danny passed over the Gulf and oil workers were returning to rigs on Friday.
Amid little change on NYMEX crudes during Asian ACCESS trading, Brent found no trading support, brokers said.
At the close, September Brent on SIMEX was settled at $18.11 per barrel after London settled at $18.12.
August NYMEX crude was last done at $19.21, for a loss of six cents from New York's close.
Brokers said Brent fell through trend-line support at $18.45 on Friday in London, which would now cap any market rise.
They cited support at the recent cyclical low of $17.80.
